reviews.review_msg: Lots of in-class participation assignments that should not be so extensive for what they're worth. But as a prof, she's very caring and teaches in an effective way that applies to the real world

Don't trust the bad reviews. Amazing teacher! I took 2 classes with her and in one now. one of the most passionate, thoughtful, understanding profs I've met. Incredibly helpful, fair, and teaches you a great deal. Do be prepared for lots of reading, smaller assignments & discussions, and a large amount of group projects (my one dislike)

Tate's version of this class is so confusing and disorganized. I echo those who posted before me in saying the grading is super unclear and weirdly marked. Tate tries to execute the class in a way that students complete assignments based on their own understanding of the projects to mimic a "real world environment," but it ultimately seems lazy.

Tate is a mediocre instructor. She definitely has some interesting things to say, but her courses are confusing and unorganized. She distributes marks through so many little assignments, you're not even sure what's worth doing. Not a difficult course, but so much work.

I took SD381 online and it was an easy grade in terms of it being marked. However, there is a lot of busy work that is ultimately tedious and the instructions are unclear. So expect to be really confused sometimes regarding instructions. But Tate is an easy and fair marker so getting a good grade is easily done.
